abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project objective was
            achieved at a satisfactory level. Project sustainability is
            likely. World Bank performance was satisfactory overall.
            Borrower performance, while uneven from the first to the
            second half of implementation, can be judged as satisfactory
            overall. The several lessons learned included the following:
            In countries where there is little movement and reform
            dialogue in the higher education sector, modest projects can
            stimulate substantial institutional development and set the
            stage for improved efficiency and more complex reforms.
            Technical assistance is more likely to have substantial
            impact on institutional development and greater skill
            transfer when conducted in close collaboration with local
            institutional staff. Modest investment in information
            technology can contribute to substantial impact on
            institutional development, particularly when there is little
            or no existing network. Small competitive or incentive funds
            within institutions of higher education can have substantial
            impact on academic culture. Administrative and
            ministry-level reforms (budgeting, finance, etc.) can be
            more broadly accepted when technical assistance and
            investments are made concurrently in more visible academic
            areas (incentive funds for faculty, internet installations,
            etc). Central and institutional cpaacity can be built
            simultaneously for synergistic impact in the higher
            education sector. Performance indicators should be defined
            early and in consultation.
